title: 1991 Currie Cup Rural C
text:
The 1991 Currie Cup Rural C was the fourth division of the <a href="Currie%20Cup">Currie Cup</a> competition, the premier domestic <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> competition in <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>. This was the 53rd season since the competition started in 1889.
Competition.
There were four participating teams in the 1991 Currie Cup Rural C competition. These teams played each other twice over the course of the season, once at home and once away. Teams received two points for a win and one points for a draw. The winner of the Rural C competition played off against the winner of the <a href="1991%20Currie%20Cup%20Rural%20D">Rural D</a> competition for the Bankfin Trophy.
In addition, all the Currie Cup Rural C teams also played in the <a href="1991%20Currie%20Cup%20Central%20/%20Rural%20Series">1991 Currie Cup Central / Rural Series</a>.
Fixtures and Results.
Final.
The winner of the Rural C competition played off against the winner of the <a href="1991%20Currie%20Cup%20Rural%20D">Rural D</a> competition for the Bankfin Trophy.
Relegation Play-Off.
In the play-off match, beat to clinch a spot in the <a href="1992%20Currie%20Cup%20Rural%20A">1992 Currie Cup Rural A</a>, while would play in the <a href="1992%20Currie%20Cup%20Rural%20B">1992 Currie Cup Rural B</a>.
